member.name: M:StructureMap.AutoMocking.IAutoMocker`1.MockObjectFactory
member.summary: Use this with EXTREME caution. This will replace the active "Container" in accessed by ObjectFactory with the AutoMockedContainer from this instance

member.name: M:StructureMap.AutoMocking.IAutoMocker`1.PartialMockTheClassUnderTest
member.summary: Calling this method will immediately create a "Partial" mock for the ClassUnderTest using the "Greediest" constructor.

member.name: M:StructureMap.AutoMocking.IAutoMocker`1.Get``1
member.summary: Gets the mock object for type T that would be injected into the constructor function of the ClassUnderTest

member.summary: Method to specify the exact object that will be used for "pluginType." Useful for stub objects and/or static mocks

member.name: M:StructureMap.AutoMocking.IAutoMocker`1.AddAdditionalMockFor``1
member.summary: Adds an additional mock object for a given T Useful for array arguments to the ClassUnderTest object

member.name: M:StructureMap.AutoMocking.IAutoMocker`1.UseConcreteClassFor``1
member.summary: So that Aaron Jensen can use his concrete HubService object Construct whatever T is with all mocks, and make sure that the ClassUnderTest gets built with a concrete T

member.name: M:StructureMap.AutoMocking.IAutoMocker`1.CreateMockArrayFor``1(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates, returns, and registers an array of mock objects for type T.

member.name: M:StructureMap.AutoMocking.IAutoMocker`1.InjectArray``1(``0[])
member.summary: Allows you to "inject" an array of known objects for an argument of type T[] in the ClassUnderTest

member.summary: Gets an instance of the ClassUnderTest with mock objects (or stubs) pushed in for all of its dependencies
